SEARCH
Package cz.cuni.mff.java.drawing

Class PluginLoader

java.lang.Object
cz.cuni.mff.java.drawing.PluginLoader
public class PluginLoader extends Object
A class responsible for loading and managing plugins for drawing pens.

The PluginLoader class dynamically loads plugins (represented by Pen instances) from a specified directory and manages their integration with the drawing application. It maintains a list of buttons that represent these plugins and provides functionality to refresh and update the list of available plugins.

The PluginLoader may be used to load generic Pen plugins, but may also be used to load plugins for a specific Pen subclass, for example ShapePen.

The plugins are loaded using a ServiceLoader. In order for a plugin to be loaded into the application, a jar file with the implementation must be placed into the specified directory and be ready for loading by a ServiceLoader. That is, it must have a META-INF/services/cz.cuni.mff.java.drawing.<Service> entry listing the implementing class(es).

x

  • Constructor Details

    • PluginLoader

      public PluginLoader(Class<? extends Pen> service, ArrayList<PenButton> buttonList, ArrayList<PenButton> permanentList, File pluginsDir, PenSettings penSettings, DrawPanelSettings panelSettings)
      Constructs a PluginLoader with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      service - the Class object representing the Pen class of one of its subclasses, which defines the service interface.
      buttonList - the list of PenButton objects to add the loaded plugins into
      permanentList - the list of PenButton objects that are always available (i.e. permanent pens and not loaded plugins)
      pluginsDir - the directory from which to load plugin jar files
      penSettings - the PenSettings to apply to each loaded pen
      panelSettings - the DrawPanelSettings to associate the buttons with

  • Method Details

    • refreshPlugins

      public void refreshPlugins() throws FileNotFoundException
      Refreshes the list of plugins to the loader's specific service by loading them from the specified plugins directory.

      This method clears the current list of plugin buttons, adds all permanent buttons back to the list, and then loads new plugins from jar files in the plugins directory. For each loaded plugin, a corresponding PenButton is created and added to the list.

      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the plugins directory is not found or is not a directory
      RuntimeException - if there is an error creating the class loader for the plugins
      See Also:
      • Pen
      • ShapePen
      • PenButton
